cyclone.name: ETA
cyclone.current_location: about 45 mi NNW of Key West, Florida and 65 mi S of Naples, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the southeastern Gulf of Mexico, expected to slow and then turn north toward the northeastern Gulf Coast late this week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend / northeastern Gulf Coast
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: N/A (storm not forecast to approach the Virginia coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect for portions of western Cuba (La Habana eastward to Isle of Youth)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for the Florida Keys, south & central Florida coast (Brevard/Volusia line to Anna Maria Island) and north-western Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Florida, Florida Keys, portions of the Florida west coast, north-western Bahamas
weather_observation.expected_closest_date_to_port: N/A (track remains well south and west of Virginia)
weather_observation.wind: Only a very small (≈3%) chance of brief tropical-storm-force gusts late in the 5-day period; otherwise normal winds expected
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected – surge threat confined to Florida peninsula and Keys
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall confined to south/central Florida; only minimal remnant rain possible in Virginia after 5+ days
weather_observation.other_hazards: Long-period swells may reach Mid-Atlantic beaches late week, creating dangerous rip currents, but operational impact to the port is minimal
